courseDetails.title: Employee Onboarding: Boost Engagement and Productivity
courseDetails.shortDescription: Employee Onboarding | New Hire Integration | Onboarding Process | Employee Engagement | HR | Talent Induction
courseDetails.longDescription:
Master Employee Onboarding: Effective Strategies for Seamless Integration


Course Description


A well-designed employee onboarding program is essential for maximizing employee engagement, reducing turnover, and ensuring a smooth transition into the company. This course provides a step-by-step guide to building a structured and effective onboarding system, from preboarding to the end of the probationary period. Learn how to create a comprehensive onboarding strategy that accelerates employee adaptation, enhances productivity, and aligns with business goals.


This course is designed for HR professionals, managers, and business leaders looking to optimize their onboarding programs, improve retention rates, and create a seamless experience for new hires. Participants will explore onboarding best practices, real-world examples, and proven methodologies used by top companies like Google and SHRM.

What You’ll Learn

• Understand the importance of onboarding and its direct impact on employee retention and engagement.

• Design a structured onboarding framework that improves employee experience and performance.

• Develop a preboarding strategy to engage new hires before their first day.

• Execute an effective first-day induction that fosters a sense of belonging.

• Implement 30-day and 90-day onboarding plans to track employee progress and ensure successful adaptation.

• Utilize onboarding gamification techniques to enhance employee engagement.

• Adapt and improve remote onboarding strategies for virtual teams.

• Conduct onboarding assessments to measure effectiveness and continuously refine the process.

Course Structure & Modules


Module 1: Understanding Onboarding & Adapting Remote Employees

• Overview of onboarding and adaptation strategies.

• SHRM’s effective onboarding model.

• Business case for investing in a structured onboarding process.

• Defining onboarding goals and economic benefits.

• Case study: Google’s onboarding approach.

• Gamification in onboarding to improve engagement.

• Essential checklists for a successful onboarding program.

• Best practices for remote employee onboarding.


Module 2: Designing a Comprehensive Onboarding Program

• Conducting a current state audit of the existing onboarding process.

• Identifying areas for improvement in onboarding workflows.

• Creating a structured onboarding program tailored to company needs.

• Defining an onboarding project roadmap.

• Developing a complete onboarding package from start to finish.


Module 3: Preboarding – Preparing Employees Before Their Start Date

• Understanding where the onboarding process begins.

• Setting up the workplace and systems before the new hire arrives.

• Communicating expectations and company values.

• Sending welcome information to new hires.

• Informing team members about incoming employees using a template announcement.

• Training managers and mentors for effective onboarding support.

• Creating a new hire handbook to streamline onboarding.


Module 4: First Day in the Company – Induction Process

• Designing an effective first-day onboarding experience.

• Roles of HR, managers, and colleagues in employee onboarding.

• Creating an engaging first-day checklist to ensure smooth integration.

• Best practices for introducing new hires to company culture.


Module 5: The First 30 Days of Onboarding

• Conducting structured onboarding interviews with new employees.

• Gathering feedback from managers on employee progress.

• Using employee onboarding surveys to measure adaptation success.

• Team dynamics and new hire integration strategies.

• Assigning mentors and monitoring their role in onboarding.

• Conducting an onboarding workshop for continuous development.

• Post-employment surveys and check-ins after 30 days.


Module 6: The First 90 Days and Completing the Onboarding Process

• Providing continuous feedback to ensure successful onboarding.

• Conducting onboarding surveys at the end of the probation period.

• Evaluating employee adaptation and performance after 90 days.

• Organizing team-building events to reinforce company culture.

• Planning the next steps for career development after onboarding.

Who Should Enroll?

• HR professionals looking to optimize their onboarding process.

• Hiring managers responsible for integrating new employees.

• Business leaders seeking to improve employee engagement and retention.

• Talent acquisition specialists designing onboarding frameworks.

• L&D professionals implementing training as part of onboarding.

Why Choose This Course?

• Practical Application – Utilize real-world examples and actionable strategies.

• Flexible Online Format – Learn at your own pace with recorded classes.

• Certification – Receive an official diploma upon successful course completion.


Transform your employee onboarding process and set your new hires up for success. Enroll today!

courseDetails.title: Learn STAAD PRO | From Zero to Hero | Hindi
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn Staad Pro by Following Step by Step instructions
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Learning & Exploring Civil Engineering Concepts & Softwares Practically.

Autodesk Revit is a building information modelling software tool for architects, landscape architects, structural engineers, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing (MEP) engineers, designers and contractors. The software allows users to design a building and structure and its components in 3D, annotate the model with 2D drafting elements, and access building information from the building model's database. Revit is 4D building information modeling application capable with tools to plan and track various stages in the building's lifecycle, from concept to construction and later maintenance and/or demolition.

Take your Revit skills to the Advanced level. First, get comfortable with the Revit environment, and learn to set up a project and add the grids, levels, and dimensions that will anchor your design. Then we dive into modeling: adding walls, doors, and windows; creating and mirroring groups; linking to DWG files; and working with floors, roofs, and ceilings. I will also shows advanced techniques for modeling stairs and complex walls, adding rooms, and creating schedules. Finally, discover how to annotate your drawing so all the components are perfectly understood, and learn how to output sheets to PDF and AutoCAD.

Finally i will also covers basics to Intermediate level of dynamo in Revit.

Herewith I had created many videos for civil engineering students & professionals in order to learn concepts & softwares practically.

In this Course you can learn following most demanded civil engineering softwares from very basic level to advanced level.

AutoCAD 2D

AutoCAD 3D,

Revit Architecture,

Revit Structure,

Revit MEP

Revit Dynamo,

Staad Pro,

Etabs,

Revit to Lumion Pro,

Preliminary Designs of Structural Members,

Leaning Bar Bending Schedule with AutoCAD & Excel,

Quantity Surveying / Building Estimation with AutoCAD & Excel,

AutoCAD Raster Design,

Introduction to ISO Global BIM Standards


With Warm Regards,

Ashish Pandit

B.E. Civil Engineering From M.S. University (First Class with Distinction) (BIM Engineer)
targetAudiences: Civil Engineers who want to pursue career in structural engineering
Civil Engineering Students who want to learn structural designing
Engineers who wish to do structural analysis and design of a building

courseDetails.longDescription:
Mastering Employee Feedback: Creating a Culture of Growth and Improvement


Course Description:


Employee feedback is one of the most powerful tools for driving performance, engagement, and professional development. Yet, many managers and leaders struggle to give and receive feedback effectively. This course is designed to help HR professionals, managers, and business leaders build a strong feedback culture within their organizations.


Through practical strategies and real-world examples, you will learn how to overcome feedback barriers, integrate continuous feedback loops, and implement recognition programs that drive motivation and productivity.


What You Will Learn:

• Understand why feedback is critical for employee engagement and performance.

• Overcome common barriers to giving feedback and develop confidence in feedback conversations.

• Master giving feedback using structured models and techniques.

• Learn to separate feedback from performance evaluation to foster growth.

• Implement feedback loops across teams and throughout the organization.

• Use feedback as a tool for coaching, development, and leadership growth.

• Recognize employee achievements and create a culture of appreciation.


Who Should Take This Course?

• HR professionals who want to improve feedback practices within their organization.

• Managers and team leaders looking to create a feedback-driven culture.

• Executives and business owners aiming to enhance employee engagement through feedback.

• Anyone looking to master the art of giving and receiving feedback in a professional setting.


Course Program:


Class 1: What is Employee Feedback and Why It Matters

• Why many people avoid giving feedback and how to change this mindset.

• The paradox: how we receive feedback everywhere but not enough from leaders.

• Understanding what feedback really is and why it is essential for organizational success.

• The role of feedback in performance improvement and employee growth.

• Why Generation Z values feedback more than previous generations.

• A simple yet effective tool for giving feedback with impact.


Class 2: What Prevents Effective Feedback and How to Overcome Barriers

• Common challenges in giving feedback and how to address them:

• Lack of support from leadership.

• False beliefs that hinder open communication.

• The role of stress and emotional resistance.

• Lack of structured feedback skills.

• Strategies to change beliefs about feedback and create a growth mindset.

• Techniques to reduce stress and anxiety when giving feedback.


Class 3: Separating Feedback from Employee Evaluation

• Why feedback and performance review are not the same.

• The importance of continuous feedback over once-a-year evaluations.

• The six-step model for daily feedback that fosters engagement.

• Preparing a structured feedback script for meaningful conversations.

• How to request feedback from employees to build trust.

• Creating a feedback cycle that promotes growth and improvement.

• Developing the skills to become a true feedback-driven coach.


Class 4: Running Feedback Loops Across the Organization

• How to introduce feedback at all levels of the company.

• Implementing feedback in executive and leadership teams.

• Identifying feedback barriers and breaking them down.

• Applying the six-step feedback model across departments.

• Structuring company-wide feedback initiatives for long-term success.


Class 5: Advanced Feedback Techniques and Leadership Hacks

• Feedback tips for different personality types.

• The concept of “feedback on feedback”—improving the way we give feedback.

• Using feedback to enhance leadership skills and managerial effectiveness.

• Addressing common questions and concerns about feedback culture.


Class 6: Recognizing Achievements as Part of a Feedback Culture

• Why recognition and feedback go hand in hand.

• Setting up monetary and non-monetary recognition programs.

• Implementing Peer-to-Peer Recognition using Google’s approach as an example.

• How to design an Employee of the Month program that truly motivates.

• Using gamification to make achievement recognition more engaging.


Why Take This Course?

• Learn from Mike Pritula, a feedback and leadership expert with extensive HR experience.

• Develop practical skills to integrate feedback into daily work routines.

• Gain real-world tools and frameworks to apply immediately in your organization.

• Receive a certificate of completion validating your expertise in feedback and performance management.

Enroll Today!


Master the art of giving and receiving feedback and transform your organization’s feedback culture. Whether you’re a manager, HR professional, or executive, this course will equip you with the skills to build a high-performing and engaged workforce through effective feedback practices.


Sign up now and start improving your feedback culture today!
targetAudiences: This course is designed for HR professionals, managers, team leaders, and anyone looking to improve their feedback delivery skills, foster employee engagement, and create a culture of recognition and continuous improvement in their organization.

courseDetails.title: Competency Based Interview: Master Modern Hiring Techniques
courseDetails.shortDescription: Competency-Based Interview | Behavioral Interview | Hiring Techniques | Recruitment | STAR Method | Talent Assessment
courseDetails.longDescription:
Mastering Competency-Based Behavioral Interviews


Course Description:


Hiring the right talent is one of the most critical aspects of building a high-performing organization. Competency-based behavioral interviews help hiring managers, recruiters, and HR professionals assess candidates effectively by focusing on past experiences and demonstrated skills. This course is designed to equip you with the knowledge, techniques, and tools needed to conduct structured, competency-based interviews that lead to better hiring decisions.


Through practical case studies, real-world examples, and interview simulations, you’ll learn how to identify key competencies, structure behavioral interview questions, and evaluate candidate responses using a scoring system. Whether you are an HR professional, hiring manager, or recruiter, this course will enhance your interviewing skills and ensure you select the best-fit candidates for your organization.

What You’ll Learn:


The Fundamentals of Competency-Based Interviews – Understand the principles behind behavioral interviewing and how it improves hiring accuracy.


Developing a Competency Model – Learn how to define core competencies for different job roles and integrate them into the hiring process.


Crafting Effective Behavioral Interview Questions – Master the STAR (Situation, Task, Action, Result) method and other structured interview techniques.


Evaluating Candidates Objectively – Implement competency-based scoring rubrics and minimize bias in the selection process.


Avoiding Common Interviewing Mistakes – Identify biases, pitfalls, and ineffective questioning methods that can lead to poor hiring decisions.


Improving Hiring Decisions with Data – Leverage competency frameworks, assessment grids, and interview scorecards for better decision-making.

Course Program:


1. Introduction to Competency-Based Interviews


• The role of behavioral and competency-based interviews in modern recruitment

• Why past behavior predicts future performance

• Difference between structured and unstructured interviews


2. Developing a Competency Model for Hiring


• Understanding competency frameworks

• Identifying technical vs. soft skills competencies

• Customizing competency models for different roles


3. Crafting Effective Behavioral Interview Questions


• Writing open-ended, behavioral interview questions

• Using the STAR method to structure candidate responses

• Common mistakes in formulating competency-based questions


4. The Interview Process: Structuring & Conducting Effective Interviews


• Best practices for planning and structuring interviews

• Conducting panel interviews using a competency-based approach

• Ensuring fairness and consistency in the hiring process


5. Competency-Based Candidate Evaluation & Decision-Making


• Designing scoring matrices for competency assessments

• Using interview scorecards for structured decision-making

• Avoiding unconscious bias in candidate evaluations


6. Improving Hiring Success with Competency-Based Interviewing


• Case studies of companies using competency-based selection

• Implementing behavioral interview training in your company

• Measuring the impact of structured hiring on talent acquisition

Who Should Take This Course?


HR professionals & recruiters looking to refine their interview process and hire high-quality candidates.


Hiring managers seeking structured, data-driven methods to evaluate candidates more effectively.


Talent acquisition specialists aiming to implement competency-based hiring frameworks.


Business leaders & team leads involved in the selection of key employees.

Why Enroll in This Course?


Learn from Industry Experts – Gain insights from experienced HR leaders and recruiters.


Practical & Actionable Knowledge – Real-life examples, downloadable templates, and interview scripts.


Step-by-Step Training – From question design to evaluation scoring, master every aspect of behavioral interviews.


Certificate of Completion – Validate your expertise in competency-based hiring.

Improve your hiring accuracy and reduce turnover by mastering behavioral, competency-based interviewing!


Enroll now and start conducting structured, effective interviews today!

courseDetails.title: MS Excel Automation | Excel Data Analysis with Python
courseDetails.shortDescription: Excel Python Bootcamp | Revolutionize Your Excel Workflow with Python Automation and Data Analysis
courseDetails.longDescription:
Introduction to MS Excel Automation | Excel Data Analysis with Python

The course "MS Excel Automation | Excel Data Analysis with Python" offers a comprehensive guide to using Python with Microsoft Excel to perform advanced data analysis and automate repetitive tasks.

The course introduces the basic concepts of Excel automation with Python libraries like openpyxl and demonstrates how to create and manipulate workbooks and sheets.

The students will learn to insert and format data, including merging and unmerging cells, adding comments, and applying conditional formatting. The course also covers various chart types, including column, line, pie, and bubble charts, and how to use formulas and data validation in Excel.

Additionally, the course teaches the students how to protect and secure workbooks and apply filters and sorting.

Upon completion of the course, the students will have a solid understanding of how to use Python with Excel to automate data analysis tasks and enhance their productivity.


Outlines for this course MS Excel Automation with OpenPyxl

  1. Introduction to Excel - Excel Python-based Libraries, Installation of openpyxl, Creating a Basic File to Insert Data into Excel using openpyxl

  2. Creating Workbook & Sheet - Inserting Data into the Cell, Accessing Cell(s), Loading a File, Comments, Saving File

  3. Inserting Image - Merging and Unmerging Cells, Formatting Text, Alignment, Border, Background Color

  4. Read-Only Mode - Write-Only Mode, openpyxl with Pandas, openpyxl with Numpy

  5. Creating Charts in Excel using openpyxl - Column Chart, Bar Chart, Line Chart, Area Chart, Bubble Chart

  6. Conditional Formatting - Greater Than a Specific Value, Less Than a Specific Value, Equal to a Specific Value, Contain Specific Value, Between Values, The First 5 Records Highlights, The Last 5 Records Highlights

  7. Sorting - Filtering, Print Settings in Excel

  8. Table with openpyxl - Table Creation, Inserting New Row and Data, Inserting New Column and Data, ROW Background Color Change, Column Background Color Change

  9. Working with Formulas - Protecting and Securing Workbooks, Data Validation in Cell


After this MS Excel Automation with Python, Student able to:

  • Understand the fundamentals of Excel and its functionalities.

  • Work with Excel files using Python-based libraries like openpyxl.

  • Install and utilize openpyxl for creating, reading, and manipulating Excel files programmatically.

  • Create workbooks and sheets, insert data into specific cells, access cell values, and modify cell content.

  • Load existing Excel files, add comments to cells, and manage file-saving operations.

  • Perform advanced operations such as inserting images, merging and unmerging cells, and formatting text, alignment, borders, and cell background colors.

  • Handle Excel files in read-only and write-only modes using openpyxl.

  • Integrate openpyxl with Pandas and Numpy libraries for data manipulation and analysis within Excel files.

  • Generate various types of charts (e.g., column, bar, line, area, bubble) in Excel using openpyxl.

  • Apply conditional formatting to highlight cells based on specific conditions.

  • Implement sorting, filtering, and print settings programmatically in Excel.

  • Manage tables in Excel, insert data, and customize appearance by changing row and column background colors.

  • Work with formulas within Excel files using Python and understand workbook security techniques like data validation and protection settings.

Instructor Experiences and Education:

Faisal Zamir is an experienced programmer and an expert in the field of computer science. He holds a Master's degree in Computer Science and has over 7 years of experience working in schools, colleges, and university. Faisal is a highly skilled instructor who is passionate about teaching and mentoring students in the field of computer science.

As a programmer, Faisal has worked on various projects and has experience in multiple programming languages, including PHP, Java, and Python.

He has also worked on projects involving web development, software engineering, and database management. This broad range of experience has allowed Faisal to develop a deep understanding of the fundamentals of programming and the ability to teach complex concepts in an easy-to-understand manner.

As an instructor, Faisal has a proven track record of success. He has taught students of all levels, from beginners to advanced, and has a passion for helping students achieve their goals.

Faisal has a unique teaching style that combines theory with practical examples, which allows students to apply what they have learned in real-world scenarios.

Overall, Faisal Zamir is a skilled programmer and a talented instructor who is dedicated to helping students achieve their goals in the field of computer science. With his extensive experience and proven track record of success, students can trust that they are learning from an expert in the field.


What you can do with OpenPyXL Python Library

1. Create new Excel workbooks and worksheets.

2. Read and write data to Excel spreadsheets.

3. Format Excel cells with fonts, colors, borders, and alignment.

4. Merge and unmerge cells in Excel.

5. Create charts, such as column, line, pie, and scatter charts, in Excel.

6. Add images to Excel spreadsheets.

7. Use conditional formatting to highlight cells that meet specific criteria.

8. Sort and filter data in Excel.

9. Create tables in Excel.

10. Validate data entered into Excel cells.

11. Work with Excel formulas, including functions and operators.

12. Protect Excel workbooks with passwords and user permissions.

13. Control print settings in Excel.


Thank you

Faisal Zamir

courseDetails.title: Cómo Crear una Página Web con WordPress y Cloudways
courseDetails.shortDescription: Crea una página web con WordPress y Cloudways, el mejor alojamiento en la nube administrado para WordPress.
courseDetails.longDescription:
¿DESEAS CREAR UNA PÁGINA WEB CON WORPDRESS Y CLOUDWAYS?


Una página web es una herramienta excelente para facilitar la comunicación y la interacción con los clientes. A través de un sitio web, los usuarios pueden acceder a información sobre productos y servicios, realizar consultas, solicitar presupuestos, dejar comentarios y mucho más.


Tener una presencia en internet es imprescindible para cualquier tipo de negocio. No importa cuál sea el tamaño de tu negocio o la industria en la que desempeñes tu actividad, la importancia de una página web es indudable, ya que actúa como el mejor escaparate digital, lo que permite que las empresas estén al alcance de cualquiera en todo momento. ¡No estar en línea equivale a perder oportunidades de negocio y visibilidad! En un mundo cada vez más digital, la sostenibilidad de las empresas depende de cómo se adapten estas a la transformación digital.


¿QUÉ ES CLOUDWAYS?


Cloudways es una plataforma de alojamiento en la nube que permite crear y administrar aplicaciones web. Ofrece servicios de computación en la nube para empresas.

Características:

  • Permite elegir entre varios proveedores de infraestructura en la nube.

  • Ofrece hosting gestionado de WordPress y WooCommerce.

  • Cuenta con un panel de control.

  • Ofrece soporte técnico 24/7.

  • Realiza copias de seguridad gestionadas.

  • Cuenta con seguridad gestionada.

  • Ofrece escalabilidad de rendimiento.

  • Cuenta con almacenamiento en caché avanzado.

  • Ofrece protección contra malware.


Beneficios:


  • Permite a los desarrolladores y negocios concentrarse en sus aplicaciones y sitios web.

  • Elimina la necesidad de conocimientos técnicos avanzados.

  • Permite implementar populares aplicaciones basadas en PHP en el alojamiento de infraestructura.

  • Ofrece una experiencia de hosting gestionado optimizada.

  • Permite migrar sitios web sin interrupciones ni complicaciones.


¿QUÉ ES WORDPRESS?


WordPress es un software gratuito o herramienta de gestión de contenidos, también llamado CMS (Content Management System), diseñada para crear y mantener fácilmente un Blog, un sitio Web o una Tienda Online.


WordPress es sin duda alguna, el mejor gestor de contenidos del mundo, y el más utilizado con diferencia, llegando actualmente a superar el 58% de cuota de mercado. Además es de código abierto y completamente gratuito.


Nuestro curso es 100% práctico, lo guiaremos a través de diversos pasos y juntos crearemos su página web con WordPress y Cloudways, de modo que al finalizar nuestro curso, tendrá su sitio web diseñado con su personalización y a su gusto.

¿QUÉ APRENDERÁS EN NUESTRO CURSO?

  • Cómo crear una cuenta gratis en Cloudways.

  • Cómo crear un servidor e instalar WordPress en Cloudways.

  • Cómo instalar una plantilla para tu sitio web.

  • Cómo personalizar la cabecera y el pie de página de tu sitio web.

  • Cómo editar las páginas de tu sitio web con Elementor.

  • Cómo apuntar un dominio a tu servidor de Cloudways.

  • Cómo instalar un certificado SSL para tu sitio web.



¿POR QUÉ ACCEDER A NUESTRO CURSO?


Nuestro curso de "Cómo Crear una Página Web con WordPress y Cloudways", es impartido por el experto y consultor de marketing digital: "Renato Yacolca",  creador de uno de los canales de YouTube más populares del mundo en los temas de tutoriales y marketing digital: Programación Fácil, SEO y Marketing, con más de 185,000 estudiantes (Botón de Plata de YouTube), en el que le mostrará las diversas formas de crear un sitio web con WordPress y Cloudways de forma rápida y sencilla.


¡ACCEDE AHORA AL CURSO!


Inscríbase ahora y empiece con su aprendizaje en nuestro curso. Hay herramientas interesantes, atractivas y nuevas que aprender con WordPress y Cloudways.

Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre el contenido del curso o algo relacionado con este tema, siempre puede publicar una pregunta en el curso o enviarme un mensaje directo.

¡Adelante, haz clic en el botón de COMPRAR AHORA y te veré en la lección 1!

Saludos,

Renato Yacolca

courseDetails.title: How to Transition to Product Management (And Succeed)
courseDetails.shortDescription: An introductory course for everyone who wants to become a Product Manager in 2024
courseDetails.longDescription:
Last Updated: March 2025


The demand for Product Management is on the rise today with more and more companies discovering how important this function is and how it accelerates the growth and innovation of a business. Product Managers are in charge of the key ingredient of every successful business – its product. They are directly involved in making core strategic growth-driving decisions. In this Linux for Data Engineer course, I will introduce you to the Linux world. Are you ready to take control of your technology and boost your career? Mastering Linux is a game-changer for IT professionals, developers, and tech enthusiasts alike. As the backbone of modern servers, cloud infrastructure, and DevOps, Linux is an essential skill that can set you apart in today's competitive job market.

This comprehensive course will transform you into a Linux expert, whether you’re a complete beginner or looking to sharpen your skills. Through a hands-on, project-driven approach, you'll learn how to install, configure, and optimize Linux systems Gain practical experience that directly applies to real-world scenarios, empowering you to boost productivity, reduce costs, and drive innovation in your organization.


Linux is a family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel, an operating system kernel first released on September 17, 1991, by Linus Torvalds. Linux is typically packaged in a Linux distribution. Distributions include the Linux kernel and supporting system software and libraries, many of which are provided by the GNU Project. Many Linux distributions use the word "Linux" in their name, but the Free Software Foundation uses the name "GNU/Linux" to emphasize the importance of GNU software, causing some controversy. Linux has grown to become a major force in computing - powering everything from the New York Stock Exchange to mobile phones, supercomputers, and consumer devices.


Popular Linux distributions include Debian, Fedora, and Ubuntu. Commercial distributions include Red Hat Enterprise Linux and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server. Desktop Linux distributions include a windowing system such as X11 or Wayland and a desktop environment such as GNOME or KDE Plasma. Distributions intended for servers may omit graphics altogether or include a solution stack such as LAMP. Because Linux is freely redistributable, anyone may create a distribution for any purpose.


We will learn:

1) Introduction to Linux

2) Linux  Distributions

3) Installing Ubuntu

4) File system Structure

5) Installing software applications

6) How to get help in Linux (Manuals)

7) Basic Operations in Linux (cd, cat, ls, mkdir, rmdir, exit, pwd, whereis, tail, head, etc)

8) System log

9) File Permissions

10) Editors (nano/vi)

11) Bash Shell Scripting (interactive script, functions, parameters, if-else loop, boolean, case, for loop, while loop and until loop)


What You'll Gain:

  • Core Linux Mastery: Learn how to navigate the Linux filesystem, manage users, automate tasks, and secure your systems like a pro.

  • High-Demand IT Skills: Discover how to efficiently manage Linux servers, optimize performance, and troubleshoot issues, setting you up for high-paying job opportunities.

courseDetails.title: Learn Chess in Hindi : Zero to Master Level
courseDetails.shortDescription: Chess Tactics, Calculation, and Pattern recognition skills that will enable you to create beautiful winning combinations
courseDetails.longDescription:
FIDE CM Kingscrusher has one goal of the course. And that is to make you a much stronger tactician than ever before in your life. You should be in a much better position by training with this course to create beautiful chess combinations on the chessboard which feature a wide range of patterns and demonstrate amazing calculation ability. In short, the goal of the course is to make you a very strong chess tactician and help you enjoy your chess to the absolute maximum.

This course has a structure which is essentially is "process" and "patterns".

PROCESS: The Art of Chess Calculation

The "process" aspect is the art of chess calculation. Even if you didn't know a single tactical pattern by name, you could still play amazing tactics just with great calculation which the course gives you a solid foundation in. Yes, even if you didn't know your forks from your pins, the "Process" part of the course as in the art of calculation would still enable you to play great chess combinations using an entire orchestra of tactical patterns without even knowing their names.

But training yourself on patterns will enhance your art of calculation and you will be able to name the key tactical patterns which are important for searching them out to practice and discuss with others as well as prompt during your calculations.

"Process" is like the software of your chess mind. "Patterns" are like the Content for that software. You need both the software and the content to be really effective as a tactician!.

==================

PROCESS -><-PATTERNS


YOUR STRENGTHS OF POSITION (PLUSSES +'s) ====> MATCH WITH <=== (MINUSES -'s)

DOWNSIDES OF OPPONENTS POSITION (FOR MAXIMUM DIFFERENTIAL between the PLUS AND MINUS)


BOTTOM UP APPROACHES >----< TOP DOWN APPROACHES

==================


Patterns help feed the process of calculation. Your goal often is to create a maximum differential between the strengths of your position which can be realised from very strong calculation skills and the downsides of the opponent's position which often requires a trained intuition and eye for potential downsides to ensure you are even aware combinational solutions might exist.

==================

PATTERNS: Tactical Patterns, Mating Patterns, Weakness of Position patterns.

courseDetails.longDescription:
Description of The Course

This course titled " ETABS: Structural Analysis and Design of a Building" teaches you all the things required for the structural analysis and design of a residential building. This course doesn't require you to have any prior experience in this software or any other structural design software. It will teach all the aspects of the software from very basic and will take you to the higher levels of the software as the course progresses. The course has been very systematically arranged so that you can best understand the software. Once you complete this course, you will have all the necessary knowledge to do the structural design of a building. You can do the structural design of buildings on your own projects.

We spent years at college but yet there are some topics that are overlooked in the engineering syllabus but are important in working fields. This course titled " ETABS: Structural Analysis and Design of a Building" has been created in order to fill that void and help students start out with structural design software. ETABS is a structural analysis and design software developed by csiamerica. It is a very powerful software that can design almost any kind of civil engineering structure.

ETABS is used for the design of beam and columns only. However, this course also contains the design of slab and the footing. Unlike other courses available online which only teach you tools of ETABS and not the actual process of analysis and design, this course takes a real-world architectural drawing of a building so as to explain the entire process from modeling up to the design.
targetAudiences: Civil engineering students
Civil engineering graduates
